hero.title: Student Scientific Organization
hero.subtitle: Advancing science through student collaboration and research

hero.title: Exploring Micro and Nano Worlds with NaMi
hero.description: Discover the fascinating world of microscopic and nanoscale phenomena through cutting-edge research and innovation.

about.title: About Us
about.description: NaMi Science Club is an association of students passionate about Nano- and Microelectronics, operating at the Department of Microelectronics and Nanotechnology of Wrocław University of Technology.

scientificResources.title: Scientific Resources
scientificResources.description: We are committed to sharing scientific knowledge and research materials. Explore our collection of academic papers, research findings, and educational resources.
scientificResources.pageDescription: Here you can find a curated collection of scientific materials, research papers, and educational resources developed by our Student Scientific Organization.

partners.title: Our Partners
partners.subtitle: We collaborate with leading academic institutions and research centers to drive scientific progress.

sponsors.title: Our Sponsors
sponsors.subtitle: We are grateful to our sponsors who support our research and innovation initiatives.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description1: The Student Scientific Organization is dedicated to fostering a community of young researchers, innovators, and science enthusiasts. Our mission is to provide a platform for students to explore their scientific interests, collaborate on cutting-edge projects, and develop skills that will shape the future of scientific discovery.
mission.description2: We believe in the power of interdisciplinary collaboration and strive to create an environment where students from various fields can come together to tackle complex scientific challenges. Through our projects, workshops, and events, we aim to bridge the gap between academic learning and real-world scientific application.

team.title: Our Team
team.description: Our organization is made up of dedicated students from diverse academic backgrounds. Each semester, we come together to push the boundaries of scientific research and innovation. Below you can see our team photos from recent semesters.

projects.title: Our Projects
projects.subtitle: Explore our cutting-edge research initiatives that are shaping the future of science and technology.

quantum.title: Photolithography station
quantum.description: The project is being carried out in cooperation with universities in America, covering interdisciplinary fields such as electronics, optics, mechanics and programming.
quantum.fullDescription: The photolithography station is the flagship project of our Science Club, as it not only fits perfectly into our area of interest, but also has the potential to become a crucial part for further development towards microsystems. The project expects the creation of photolithographic masks with a resolution of up to 5 µm, a key element in the fabrication of microstructures. The main component of the system will be a projector equipped with a source of ultraviolet light, which, thanks to a specialized optical system, will be appropriately scaled and emitted onto prepared surfaces. High-accuracy manipulators will complete this precision system. The stand will be an excellent combination of innovative engineering thought and a practical approach to modern technological challenges.

energy.title: Point Probe Measumerment Station
energy.description: Point Probe Measumerment Station is an advanced device that allows detailed analysis of the electrical properties of semiconductors, microstructures and thin-film materials.
energy.fullDescription: A key component of the system are precision point probes - thin needle contacts that allow contact with the test object at the micrometer level. The bench uses an SMU (Source Measure Unit) power supply that simultaneously generates electrical signals and measures the responses of the components under test. Integrating these functions in a single unit not only ensures simplification of the testing process, but also exceptional measurement accuracy, orders of nanoampere. Precision micromanipulators, a measurement platform and support for microscopy technologies make this device a versatile tool for highly accurate electrical measurements in microstructures

ai.title: Smart cane for the blind and visually impaired
ai.description: Project focusing on integration of sensor signal processing and analysis algorithms to improve safety and quality of life for visually impaired people
ai.fullDescription: Our smart cane project is an initiative to support blind and visually impaired people through the use of advanced technologies. The device features pressure and proximity sensors to accurately detect whether the user is holding the cane, and algorithms to minimize false detections. An accelerometer and gyroscope will allow the device to recognize falls and pick up the cane based on changes in acceleration and angular velocity. The project will also use speech processing technology based on MFCC coefficients and lightweight neural network models, providing efficiency on devices with limited computing power. We plan to miniaturize the device and integrate it with a mobile application via Bluetooth to make the system more functional and ready for daily use.
